justification: “The same Big Five measure was administered in each questionnaire and items were selected from the Big Five Inventory (BFI; John & Srivastava, 1999).”
“Items were selected from the Big Five Inventory (BFI …) … agreeableness … had three items.”
“Items were selected from the Big Five Inventory (BFI …) … conscientiousness … had three items.”
“Items were selected from the Big Five Inventory (BFI …) … neuroticism … had three items.”
“Items were selected from the Big Five Inventory (BFI …) … openness had four items.”

measured_by: calculation from height and weight variables
justification: “For health outcomes, we will look at BMI (calculated from height and weight variables).”

measured_by: single self-report item on 1–5 Likert scale
binary item on ever use of alcohol or cigarettes
justification: “… if the youth ever reported use of alcohol or cigarettes (referred to as ‘substance use’ … ; 0 = no, 1 = yes).”

measured_by: average of math and German grades (1–6 scale)
justification: “grades in school (averaged across grades for math and German; possible scores of 1-6).”

measured_by: composite frequency of arguing with family members (0–4 scale)
justification: “a composite of frequency of arguing with family … will be the outcome (0 = never, 4 = very often).”
“For civic engagement-related variables, number of close friends … will be the outcomes.”

measured_by: average frequency of engagement in listed leisure activities (0–4)
justification: “… an average of frequency of engagement in leisure activities (0 = never, 4 = daily).”

measured_by: single item frequency of church attendance (0–4)
justification: “… frequency of church attendance (0 = never, 4 = daily) … will be the outcomes.”
“… frequency of volunteering (0 = never, 4 = daily) will be the outcomes.”
